snippet: For stations replacing NPR’s call-in show “Talk of the Nation” with an expanded version of “Here and Now,” contributions to the newsmagazine will be crucial.
abstract: Media Decoder blog; public radio stations nationwide choose their new midday programming to replace NPR's 21-year-old call-in show Talk of the Nation, which signed off; NPR's replacement offering, expanded two-hour version of existing Here & Now program, will be carried by 302 stations, in contrast to 407 stations for Talk.
lead_paragraph: For stations replacing NPR’s call-in show “Talk of the Nation” with an expanded version of “Here and Now,” contributions to the newsmagazine will be crucial.

headline.main: Public Radio’s Midday Show to Include Local Contributions
